speaker: Frasier
text: Which not only helps in the healing process, but also provides one with the confidence to go forward, in spite of the fear this kind of trauma can cause.  Honestly, I can't say enough about these medicated bandage strips.  But thank you for asking, Jordan.  [_He happily wiggles his finger, Roz looks bored to tears._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Up next is the stock market report with Julia Wilcox.  [_He switches off and there is a knock at the door.  Frasier waves the man in._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Hello, Avery.  Impeccable timing.

speaker: Avery
text: Good to see you Frasier.  [_He reaches out and shakes Frasier's hand._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, hello. Oh, careful, careful.  Paper cut.

speaker: Avery
text: Yes, I caught the last half hour of your show.  [_Roz comes in._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Ah.  Oh, Roz, come meet an old friend of mine.  Avery McManus, this is Roz Doyle, my producer.

speaker: Avery
text: Lovely to meet you.

speaker: Roz
text: Same here.

speaker: Frasier
text: Avery and I used to live across the hall from each other back at Oxford, now he lives in Seattle.  A very accomplished accountant who's going to take me on as a client.

speaker: Roz
text: Well, my taxes could use some serious doing.

speaker: Frasier
text: Roz, he's married. [_ushering her back to her side_] I tell you what: I'll be back in about an hour to go over this month's "Best of".

speaker: Avery
text: Oh, I don't think an hour is going to be long enough, Frasier.  Your finances are a mess.  Your spending's out of control.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well that's impossible.  I'm very prudent.

speaker: Avery
text: Then what about this nine thousand dollar caviar bill from last month?  And what's with you and wine?  I had to take on an associate just to go through your sherry receipts.  And then...

speaker: Frasier
text: Gosh, you know, I've completely forgotten myself.  How is Amanda?  I don't believe I've seen her since the wedding.

speaker: Avery
text: Amanda's great.  She made partner.  [_Julia walks in._]

speaker: Julia
text: Okay, everybody, the "I'm a Pathetic Loser" show is over.

speaker: Frasier
text: My listeners are not pathetic losers.

speaker: Julia
text: I wasn't referring to your listeners.

speaker: Avery
text: You're Julia Wilcox.

speaker: Julia
text: Yes, I am.

speaker: Avery
text: You wrote "Practical Applications of Econometrics".

speaker: Julia
text: Yes, I did.

speaker: Avery
text: I loved that book.  Avery McManus.

speaker: Julia
text: Oh, it's a pleasure to meet a fan, Avery.  [_She turns to Frasier._]

speaker: Julia
text: A fan is someone who enjoys your work.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, and do you know what they call someone who can't stand your work?

speaker: Julia
text: In your case, the public.  [_She sits down for her show._]

speaker: Frasier
text: She was supposed to say "What?" and I was going to say "Me." Oh, come on, let's get out of here.  [_He walks off in a huff.  Avery smiles at Julia then heads out too. Fade out._]   [_Fade in.  Eddie is on the couch.  Martin is on Daphne's massage table while she works him over._]

speaker: Martin
text: Ow!  How come you only rub where it hurts?

speaker: Daphne
text: Your sons hired me to torture you so that's what I'm doing.

speaker: Martin
text: Ow!  Eddie, Daddy's in trouble.  Sic her!  [_Eddie lifts his head to look at Martin, then lays back down._]

speaker: Daphne
text: Okay, all done, old man.  And I hope you got your griping out of your system, because I need you to be on your best behavior next time.  [_He gets to his feet._]

speaker: Martin
text: Why?

speaker: Daphne
text: Because, the agency won't assign me any more clients until an evaluator observes me at work.  [_He sits in his chair._]

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, geez. I don't want to go on display like some trained seal.

speaker: Daphne
text: Please?  I'll give you some treats.

speaker: Martin
text: Treats, huh?  Okay.  [_She starts putting her things away as Frasier comes in the front door._]

speaker: Martin
text: Hey, Fraizh.  How was your trip to the accountant?

speaker: Frasier
text: Fine, fine.  Uh, why are all these lights on?  All right, I'll be honest with you.  Avery had some very stern warnings for me.  The situation isn't dire, but it could become serious if I don't change my ways.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, that doesn't sound too tough.  Get balcony seats at the opera.

speaker: Daphne
text: And stop throwing away your change.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, that was one time!  And if you'd seen that cashier's fingernails, you'd have done the same thing.  All right, the point is I have to come up with a plan.  A plan... Perhaps a ruminative latte will do me some good at Nervosa.

speaker: Martin
text: What?  You just had a whole new espresso machine shipped here from Italy!

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, well I'm waiting for the cups!  [_He dons his coat and heads for the door._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Besides, Nervosa is more to me than just a place for coffee. It's my refuge, my sanctuary for contemplation.  Oh!  Oh, I've just had a cost-saving idea!  Daphne, you're family now and yet I still pay you full price for Dad's therapy.  [_Daphne looks outraged._]

speaker: Frasier
text: All right, I'll keep thinking.  Off I go!  [_He leaves.  Fade out._]   [_Fade in.  Niles and Frasier are chatting at a table._]

speaker: Niles
text: This happens every time you hire a new accountant.  You let their fear get to you.  But remember: it's Avery's job to worry about your finances, not yours.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, of course it is, of course it is.  He's the professional.  Thanks so much, Niles, that's really quite helpful.  I feel better now.  Excuse me, change my shortbread order to tart tatin.  One for my brother, please, a la mode.

speaker: Niles
text: He's back.  [_They happily start to drink, only to be interrupted by a loud jangling chord from an electric guitar.  A man is playing by the door._]

speaker: Ben
text: You ready for some more music, Seattle?  [_Everyone applauds._]

speaker: Ben
text: Great!  [_He starts strumming away again.  Frasier rushes over and unplugs his amplifier.  The crowd groans._]

speaker: Frasier
text: I quite agree!  I am sorry, young man.  If we wanted to hear your music, we would attend one of your concerts.  In the bus station.

speaker: Ben
text: Well, people seem to like it.  Here, they clap along, and it's been enough to keep me out of the three piece cage.

speaker: Frasier
text: The what?

speaker: Ben
text: The suit, man, the suit.  [_A woman walks up._]

speaker: Maureen
text: Excuse me, is there a problem?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, yes, as a matter of fact there is.  This man is making it impossible for me to converse with my brother.

speaker: Maureen
text: I think he's great.

speaker: Frasier
text: Ah.  I understand.  You two are friends.  Perhaps you used to "gig" together in your salad days.  But if you wish to alter the atmosphere of this cafe, I suggest you consult with the owner.

speaker: Maureen
text: I am the owner.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh really.  Well, I'm Frasier Crane, it's a pleasure.

speaker: Maureen
text: Maureen Nervosa.

speaker: Frasier
text: Really?  Well, I happen to be one of your core customers, Ms. Nervosa.  In of fact, I spend over three thousand dollars a year here, which I just found out today.

speaker: Niles
text: Frasier, people are starting to stare.  Let's just come back tomorrow afternoon when the cafe is quieter.

speaker: Maureen
text: Actually, Ben will be playing afternoons from now on.

speaker: Frasier
text: Really?  Well you know, I, I would think about that. Although we do adore your establishment, if there is one thing we can find in Seattle it is another coffee shop.

speaker: Ben
text: Yeah, but not many of them will let you change in the men's room.

speaker: Frasier
text: Now,  I don't relish the idea of asking you this, but I'm afraid you will have to choose.  Either...

speaker: Maureen
text: I choose Ben.

speaker: Frasier
text: I see.  Well, farewell, Nervosa.  It's been a splendid decade, but I'm afraid your brew has become a bit too bold for my brother and me.  Come, Niles, let's go.

speaker: Niles
text: But, I don't want to go.  Nervosa is my haven, my cocoon.

speaker: Ben
text: This next one's called "The Wild Rover"!  [_The crowd applauds as Niles starts to follow Frasier._]

speaker: Ben
text: I've been a wild rover, for many a year. And I spent all me money on whisky and beer.  [_Maureen taps Niles on the shoulder, then takes the cup and saucer back from him.  He follows Frasier out.  Cut to - the outside as they glance dejectedly in the window._]

speaker: Ben
text: And now I'm returning with gold in great store, And I never will play the wild rover no more. And it's no, nay, never...no, nay, never no more...  [_The brothers walk off.  Fade out._]   **THREE DAYS AND FIVE COFFEE SHOPS LATER...** [_Fade in.  Frasier and Niles are at the counter._]

speaker: Frasier
text: My name is Frasier, this is my brother Niles.  We're thinking of making this our regular haunt.

speaker: Steve
text: [_deadpan_] Way to go.

speaker: Frasier
text: We'll have two espressos, please.  I'm sorry, and your name is?

speaker: Steve
text: Steve.

speaker: Frasier
text: Stephen.  Outstanding.

speaker: Steve
text: Just Steve.

speaker: Frasier
text: Steve.  I look forward to years of this sort of lively banter.  [_He pays for the coffee and he and Niles go over to a table._]

speaker: Niles
text: They found a way to bring the charm of an airport to a mid-town location.

speaker: Frasier
text: Now, Niles, let's try to be positive, this may be out new home.  [_Niles dusts off his chair and they sit._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, this will do nicely.  This will be our regular table. [_pointing_] And that will be our backup regular table.  [_Julia comes in._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, perhaps we should keep looking.  [_They rise._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Hello, Julia.

speaker: Julia
text: Hello, Frasier.  Wow, who's this?  Your stunt double?  [_Frasier pats Niles on the back._]

speaker: Frasier
text: This is my brother Niles.  Niles, I'd like you to meet my colleague, Julia Wilcox.

speaker: Niles
text: How do you do?  [_They shake._]

speaker: Julia
text: Wow, that's very good, Frasier, I didn't even see your lips move.  I thought you always go to Nervosa.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, sadly, no more.  They've hired a terribly annoying folk singer, whose hideous noise making has made it impossible for me to enjoy my one sanctuary.

speaker: Julia
text: I didn't ask for your life story.  [_Steve brings their coffees over._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Steve, I'm afraid we'll be taking these to go, thank you.

speaker: Julia
text: Oh, glad to hear it.  Goodbye, Frasier.  Goodbye, Emergency Frasier.  [_She walks to the counter._]

speaker: Niles
text: I don't like her.

speaker: Frasier
text: I don't like her cafe anymore.  Let's go.  [_Steve brings their coffees back in take out cups._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, thank you, Steve.  I'm sorry to have to tell you this, but I'm afraid my brother and I will not be the everyday stalwarts I predicted we would be.

speaker: Steve
text: Damn.  Every time I open my heart...  [_Getting the hint, the boys just smile, nod, and leave.  Julia heads to the back of the cafe.  A man puts down his newspaper and rises.  It is Avery.  Frasier comes back in to get some sugar packets and turns just in time to see them embrace and kiss.  He stares in shock, hides his face and hurries out.  Fade out._]  _Act 2  Scene 1 - Frasier's Apartment_  [_Fade in.  Martin is in his chair while Daphne sets up her massage table.  Frasier is pacing._]

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, Avery was always a bit of a playboy, but honestly I thought marriage would settle him down. I should just tell Julia that he's married.  But then again, she's been so rude to me, why should I do something nice for her?  But then again, can I just sit idly by and keep my mouth shut?

speaker: Martin
text: I can answer that one.

speaker: Daphne
text: Doesn't he wear a ring?

speaker: Frasier
text: No, but I know he has one.  I was at the wedding.  Dad, you see I'm facing a perplexing dilemma, here.  Some guidance would be welcome.  [_He sits down on the couch._]

speaker: Martin
text: No it wouldn't.  You always ask my opinion, and then completely ignore it.  Well this time, while I've got the floor, I'm gonnna talk about what I want to talk about. NBA referees need to enforce the traveling rule.  It's dribble-one step-shoot, not dribble-step-step-step-STEP- shoot!  Thank you.

speaker: Frasier
text: That was very helpful.  I guess I'll just do what I always do: sort through this myself.  [_He gets up and puts on his jacket._]

speaker: Frasier
text: All right, I'm off to Nervosa.  No.  I'm off to that...other place where young Steve works.  No.  That's Avery and Julia's place.  Well, I hope you're both satisfied, now I don't know where the hell I'm going!  [_He grabs his keys and leaves.  Fade out._]   [_Fade in.  Frasier is standing at the counter._]

speaker: Frasier
text: I'm hashing over an ethical dilemma, so I think I could use some black coffee.

speaker: Server
text: What size would you like?

speaker: Frasier
text: Uh, I've got a lot to ponder, so I think a large.

speaker: Server
text: I'm afraid we don't have large, sir.  We have piccolo, macho, mucho and mucho macho.

speaker: Frasier
text: I see.  Uh, do you happen to know what size would correspond to a Nervosa grande?

speaker: Server
text: No.  But our mucho is about the same as the semi-colossal over at Don't Spill the Beans.

speaker: Frasier
text: Ah, ah, all right. I know that their colossal is comparable to a Nervosa grande, so the semi-colossal would be three quarters of a colossal, so the mucho and the semi-colossal would be equivalent... so I should have the mucho macho.  But only fill it five-eighths.

speaker: Server
text: Yes sir.  For fifty cents extra, we can pre-heat the vessel.

speaker: Frasier
text: No.  Can we just move this along, please?

speaker: Server
text: I understand completely.  Your zip-code, please?  [_Frasier looks at him questioningly._]

speaker: Server
text: [_whispering_] You don't have to give your real zip if you don't want to.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_whispering too_] Than what's the point?

speaker: Server
text: It unlocks the cash register.

speaker: Frasier
text: Put in whatever code you wish. [_He hands over the cash._] Here we are.  Now, I'd just like a cup of coffee and a quiet place to drink it.

speaker: Server
text: Can do, sir.  Okay, here's your change, you're number four, I'll bring it to your bean bag.  [_Frasier drops the extra one in the tips basket and turns, stone faced, to the bean bags seats spread around the shop.  Steeling himself, he walks over to one and lowers himself, finally plopping against the wall.  Fade out._]   [_Fade in.  The evaluator is there to observe Daphne's work with Martin._]

speaker: Evelyn
text: Now, you have a bullet lodged in your hip, correct?

speaker: Martin
text: Do I?  Oh, that's right, I do.  Sometimes I forget, the way Daphne takes care of me.  She's the best.

speaker: Evelyn
text: All right.  And how would you rate your level of comfort during therapy?

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, I don't think you can come up with a number high enough, so I'll just say... thirty.  [_The Evelyn's cell phone rings and she gets it._]

speaker: Evelyn
text: Sorry.  Oh, it's my nanny.  Well, not MY nanny.  Wouldn't that be somethin'?  Do you mind?

speaker: Daphne
text: No, please, go ahead.  [_She points and the Evelyn walks back towards the coat balcony doors._]

speaker: Evelyn
text: Hi.

speaker: Daphne
text: What are you doing?

speaker: Martin
text: What do you think?  I'm makin' you look good.

speaker: Daphne
text: Yeah, well stop it. My work speaks for itself.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, Daphne, I love you but sometimes you can be so naive. Sure you're good at the job, but you need a little salesmanship.  That's why I'm here.

speaker: Daphne
text: If you so much as...  [_She breaks off as the evaluator returns._]

speaker: Evelyn
text: Sorry about that.  Suzy got stuck in the laundry chute again.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, poor thing.  How old is she?

speaker: Evelyn
text: What's the difference?  After tomorrow, she's not our nanny anymore.  All right, shall we begin, Martin?

speaker: Martin
text: Are you kidding?  This is my favorite part of the day.  [_He gets up and settles on the massage table._]

speaker: Evelyn
text: Whenever you're ready, Daphne.

speaker: Daphne
text: First I like to start with some simple range-of-motion exercises to warm up the muscles.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, am I on a cloud?  'Cause that's how it feels, like I'm on a cloud.

speaker: Daphne
text: Then some strokes around the flexus smoothing out any knots.

speaker: Evelyn
text: And do you feel any discomfort, Martin?

speaker: Martin
text: Discomfort?  Try disbelief.  I don't know how she does it.

speaker: Evelyn
text: You know, physical therapy shouldn't be a pleasure trip.  It is challenging, healing work. You really need to be digging into the muscles there, Daphne.

speaker: Daphne
text: Yeah, I...

speaker: Evelyn
text: Let me show you.  [_She takes Daphne's place and starts in._]

speaker: Martin
text: Ahhhh!  That did it, all right.

speaker: Evelyn
text: Oh, that's not so bad.  I think you've just been pampered a little too long, huh?  [_She starts to press in with her elbow._]

speaker: Martin
text: Ohhh!

speaker: Evelyn
text: That is the sound of progress.  Think you can work like this?

speaker: Daphne
text: Watch me.  [_She laces her fingers and bends them back to crack the knuckles. Martin looks worried, then lets out a small, nervous noise.  Fade out._]   [_Fade in.  Roz and Niles are sitting at a table together._]

speaker: Roz
text: You can stop checking the door.  Frasier swore he'd never come back here.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, I'm not worried about him.  Yes, we do have a pact to boycott Nervosa, but I only came in her because I saw you sitting alone and I thought you needed company.  [_Ben has set up again._]

speaker: Ben
text: Are you ready for some more music?  [_The patrons respond enthusiastically, Niles less so._]

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, fudge.  Time to go.

speaker: Roz
text: Why don't you like Ben?  He's really nice.  He was selling his CDs outside, I got "Abbey Road" and the soundtrack from "Grease".

speaker: Ben
text: I'm gonna need a little bit of help with this one. [_pointing to Niles_] What about you, sir, what about you?

speaker: Roz
text: Yeah.

speaker: Ben
text: Can you keep a steady beat for me?

speaker: Niles
text: Sorry, no.

speaker: Ben
text: What do you think, Nervosa?  Is he the man for the job?  [_Everyone applauds, Roz pushes Niles forward as he protests._]

speaker: Ben
text: He doesn't really think you mean it.  [_Everyone claps louder, Roz gives him a big shove._]

speaker: Roz
text: Go!

speaker: Niles
text: [_to Ben_] If I do this, will you take a break?

speaker: Ben
text: Yeah, I love breaks, bloke.  He says yes!  [_Ben hands Niles a small maraca and starts to play, Niles interrupts him._]

speaker: Niles
text: Sorry, are you going to stick with that 4/4 tempo?

speaker: Ben
text: Yeah, yeah.  [_Ben starts playing again, Niles interrupts again._]

speaker: Niles
text: Would you call that sort of an andante feeling?

speaker: Ben
text: Just shake it, okay?!  [_He starts once more.  Niles covers his ear and starts shaking the sand._]

speaker: Ben
text: Tie me kangaroo down, sport, tie me kangaroo down. Tie me kangaroo down, sport, tie me kangaroo down. Watch me wallaby feed, mate, watch me wallaby feed. It's a dangerous breed, mate, watch me wallaby feed.  All together now...  [_Niles gets a little more into it, smiling as everyone claps and sings along._]

speaker: Ben
text: Tie me kangaroo down, sport, tie me kangaroo down. Tie me kangaroo down, sport, tie me kangaroo down.  Let's show 'em!  [_Ben plays strong and loud as Niles starts to stamp his feet and dance in rhythm.  He becomes more and more flamboyant, snapping his fingers and shaking the maraca over is head as Frasier comes in._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles!  [_Everyone stops and silence falls.  Niles breaks for the door, shoving past Frasier._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Don't you run, you coward!

speaker: Ben
text: I'll be right back. Oh, by the way, ten dollars is still the best price for "Quadrifinia".  [_He rushes out as Frasier goes over to Roz's table._]

speaker: Roz
text: Well, well, look who's here.  I thought you were Nervosa non grata.

speaker: Frasier
text: I had no place else to go.

speaker: Server
text: Would you like your usual?

speaker: Frasier
text: More than you could possibly know.  [_Ben has come back in and strums his guitar._]

speaker: Ben
text: This is a song I wrote about doing the right thing.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, lord, I'm gonna need that to go.

speaker: Ben
text: I think we always know in our hearts what the right thing is, but we don't always have the courage to do it.  In my case, I knew this guy, what was playin' around with a woman.  But what she didn't know was, he already had a girlfriend.  [_Frasier looks up at this._]

speaker: Ben
text: Anyway, I was the only one who knew the facts, but what was I to do?  Tell the guy to back off?  Tell the girl that she was dating a sleaze?  So I thought, and I thought and here's what I done.  [_Frasier looks hopeful.  Ben strums, but there is a twang._]

speaker: Ben
text: Oh, what a drag, I broke a string.  Anyway, I'll be back in a mo'.  [_He sets the guitar down and Frasier rushes over to him._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Excuse me, excuse me.

speaker: Ben
text: What?

speaker: Frasier
text: What happened?

speaker: Ben
text: What?

speaker: Frasier
text: In the song, what happened?

speaker: Ben
text: I have to think all the way through it.  Uh, "I knew a guy who had the wandering eye..."

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, we know that part.  What next?

speaker: Ben
text: "He met a lady, he told her a lie..."

speaker: Frasier
text: Right, and then?

speaker: Ben
text: Chorus.  Repeat chorus.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, yes, but the end.  How did it end?

speaker: Ben
text: [_singing loudly_] "San Antonia Blues!"  [_Frasier just stares at him a moment, then turns and leaves the cafe. Fade out._]   [_Fade in.  There is a pounding on the door and Avery hurries to get it._]

speaker: Avery
text: I said I'm coming!  [_He opens the door to reveal Frasier._]

speaker: Avery
text: Frasier.  What can I do for you?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_coming in_] Avery, we need to talk.

speaker: Avery
text: I'm a little busy at the moment.

speaker: Frasier
text: I'm sorry, it can't wait.  I know about you and Julia Wilcox.

speaker: Avery
text: I have no idea what you're...

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, stop that!  You are a married man.  I realize this may be fun and games to you, but she could get hurt.

speaker: Avery
text: This is really not a good time.

speaker: Frasier
text: And why the hell not?

speaker: Julia
text: Because I'm in the closet!  [_She steps out, looking a bit put off._]

speaker: Frasier
text: I had no idea.  I didn't mean for you to overhear...

speaker: Julia
text: What?  That Avery is married?  I already know.

speaker: Frasier
text: You do?

speaker: Julia
text: We're having an affair, you idiot.  [_Frasier looks chagrined._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I'm sorry.  I thought I was helping you.

speaker: Julia
text: Are you finished helping yet?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, as a matter of fact I am.  I'm also finished thinking that you and I owe each other the loyalty of professional kinship.  From this day forward we are merely coworkers, cut and dried. [_to Avery_] And as for you, I am deducting my mileage here as a business expense.  [_He walks out._]

speaker: Avery
text: Unbelievable.  Are you all right?

speaker: Julia
text: Yeah, yeah.  He was just trying to help, in his own heavy handed way.

speaker: Avery
text: He was always trying to be the hero.  You know, one night back at Oxford, he crawled out onto a ledge to rescue what turned out to be a gargoyle.  [_They share a laugh and his phone rings.  He goes over to check it._]

speaker: Avery
text: Ah, it's my wife.  Excuse me.  [_He answers._]

speaker: Avery
text: Hello? ... Hello, darling. ... Well, I miss you too. ... Ah, not long.  [_He continues talking as Julia steps away, looking pensive.  Fade out._]   [_Fade in.  Frasier walks in and goes over to the counter._]

speaker: Frasier
text: When does the alleged music start?

speaker: Server
text: It doesn't.  Ben quit.

speaker: Frasier
text: Really?  Why?

speaker: Server
text: Ask him yourself.  [_Frasier turns to see Ben walking in, wearing a three piece suit._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, well.  That's quite a sharp looking three piece cage. What happened?

speaker: Ben
text: Well you know, I don't really know.  Some little blonde doxy came in here and hooked me up with a job at the Pelham Bay bank.  [_to server_]  Have you got my check, old man?

speaker: Server
text: In the back. [_to Frasier_] Do you want that for here or to go?

speaker: Frasier
text: For here.  I'm staying.  [_Julia walks up behind him._]

speaker: Julia
text: Congratulations, Frasier.  You got your cafe back.

speaker: Frasier
text: Whatever.  [_She starts to head out._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Say, Julia, wait.  [_She turns back._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Didn't you used to be on the board of the Pelham Bay Bank?

speaker: Julia
text: You want to know my bio?  Go to my website.  [_She leaves.  Frasier smiles and gets his coffee.  Fade out._]
